turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: QUICKLY MEN... WORD ASSOCIATION, COOP. WHAT ARE YOU THINKING ABOUT RIGHT NOW?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Teresa Banks.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: ALBERT?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: It was a year ago today that Teresa Banks was killed. I'm wondering if the murderer will ever kill again.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: ALBERT, WHY TYLENOL?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Agent Chet said he wanted to check the trailer court one more time. He had me drive the van with the body back here. Which we did. It was 105 miles.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Anything else?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Did Gordon show you a woman named Lil?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: I'm up to speed, Stanley.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Agent Chet wouldn't tell me what the Blue Rose meant.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: And neither will I.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Oh, alright.  You know, I liked Agent Desmond. He had his own M.O.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I cracked the Whiteman case with this.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Stanley, I heard all about it.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: No one could've found those splinters without a machine like this and no one has a machine like this.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Tell me about the letter.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Take a look at this. Chet and I found it under Teresa Banks' ring fingernail.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: And no one found the ring?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: No, sir, we did not.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Where is the ring?

turns.speaker: MAN FROM ANOTHER PLACE
turns.text: Someone else has it now.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: That would indicate that it's the future.

turns.speaker: MAN FROM ANOTHER PLACE
turns.text: The later events have never been kept a secret.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Where am I? And how can I leave?

turns.speaker: MAN FROM ANOTHER PLACE
turns.text: You are here and there is no place to go...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Had the FBI here once before. Back in the fifties when Hap was running the place.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Where's Hap?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's dead -- good and dead.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Sorry to hear it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He didn't suffer.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I'd like to ask you a few questions about Teresa Banks

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sheriff Cable's already asked me a few questions about Teresa Banks. She worked nights for a month. That's it.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Any friends?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Ever see her with someone else?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Did she ever mention any friends?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  Ask Irene over there.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Take a good look around. There's nobody in this place -- you're meetin' the reason why. What'll it be?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: How come Jack let's you work here?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Jack and I are united in holy matrimony.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Say no more.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation, Special Agent Chet Desmond. I'd like to ask you a few questions about Teresa Banks. Jack said you knew her. How well?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: She only worked here a month. Nice girl. Never seemed to get here on time though. Ask me she had a little problem with --

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Came looking for a job with a friend of hers. Pretty girl. Could've been her sister.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: What happened to her?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: There was only one job. Teresa took the job. Her friend took a hike. Never saw her again.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Did you ever see Teresa take cocaine?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Do you take cocaine, Irene?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: No, I do not. I never took cocaine or any other drugs. I don't take drugs.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: He's with me.  Anything you would like to tell us about Teresa Banks that would help us out?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I've thought about that. I think her death is what you would call a "freak accident".

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: You know, I never told anybody, but once for about three days, just before her time, Teresa's arm went completely dead.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Her left arm. It was numb. She said she couldn't use it. Said it had no feeling. Probably from the drugs she was taking.  I just thought I ought to tell you.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: That was really something.  That dancing girl.  What did it mean?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Code. If you work with Gordon you learn that right away.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Code, I've heard a lot about this.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Sort of shorthand.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Shorthand. Really?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: We're heading into a difficult situation.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: How do you figure?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I'll explain it to you. Do you remember Lil's dance?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Lil was wearing a sour face.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Her face had a sour look... that means we're going to have trouble with the local authorities. They are not going to be receptive to the FBI.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Oh, the uncle is missing.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Not Cole's Uncle but probably the sheriff's uncle in federal prison.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: So the sheriff had got an Uncle who's committed a serious crime.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Right, which is probably why Lil was wearing a red wig meaning we are headed into a dangerous situation. Let me ask you something, Stanley, did you notice anything about the dress?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: The dress she was wearing had been altered to fit her. I noticed a different colored thread where the dress had been taken in. It wasn't her dress or she must have lost some weight.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Gordon said you were good. The tailored dress is our code for drugs. Did you notice what was pinned to it?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: A blue rose.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Very good, but I can't tell you about that.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: What did Gordon's tie mean?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: What? That's just Gordon's bad taste.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Why couldn't he have just told you all these things?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: He talks loud. And he loves his code.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I see. He does talk loud.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Gordon would not have sent us to Deer Meadow without thinking it was a high priority situation.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: It must be a high priority situation.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Solved the Whiteman Case with this.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: That's what I heard.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: No one could find those splinters without a machine like this. And no one had a machine like this.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Yes, it is good.  What do you think is in these other drawers?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I don't know, Sam.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Maybe, later we could take a look.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Sure, but let's finish up with this first.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Crushed skull. Probable cause repeated blows to the back of the head with an obtuse angled blunt object. Subject looks to be between 16 and 18 years of age.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Cole said she was 17.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: There appears to be a contusion under the ring finger of her left hand.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Accidental?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Agent Desmond, would you hold the finger for me. There's something up there.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: It is a piece of paper with the letter "T" imprinted on it. Take a look.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Geez, Agent Desmond, it's three-thirty in the morning. Where are we going to sleep?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: We're not. You and I are going to get some food.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Yes, it's been several hours since we've eaten. I didn't realize that so much time had past, did you, Agent Desmond?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Agent Desmond, it's...

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: It's late, Sam.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: It's not late, it's early. Really early.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I doubt it was drugs, more likely a problem with a nerve. I could recheck the arm for injuries, but for real nerve work we are going to have to take the body back to Portland.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I think that's a good idea.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I think we should see the sun rise at the Canyon Trailer Park.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Are you speaking to me in a code?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: No, Sam, I'm speaking plainly and I mean just exactly what I say.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: In that case, we should go to the Canyon Trailer Park.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: She lived alone.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: She must have known someone.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: You better dust this place, Sam.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I'll get my kit.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Take a look at this.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: She's wearing a ring.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: My guess is there isn't enough detail in the photo to get an idea of the design on the ring, but we should do a blowup of this anyway.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: May I see the magnifying glass, Agent Desmond?  There doesn't seem to be enough detail in the photo to ascertain the design on the ring.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: I couldn't help but notice that you had a suspicion that Deputy Cliff was the murderer. You did think that, didn't you, Agent Desmond?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: He's not the murderer.  But he's a bozo.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Yes, he is like a clown.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: When he says, "Discussion", how do you take that, Agent Desmond?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I don't take it, Sam. I give it.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: One thing that has been troubling me. That lamp at the diner. Do you think they were working on it for esthetic reasons or was their work due to faulty wiring?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Faulty wiring.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Esthetics are subjective, aren't they, Agent Desmond?  I'm Sam Stanley. If you ever need me.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Thanks, Sam, for the good work. You have a good eye for detail.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: We do notice things, don't we, Agent Desmond? Are you going back to the trailer park for the Blue rose?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: If I am going to get through math today, you're going to have to bring me up to speed quick.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You didn't do your homework?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Noooo...

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Okay, this test is going to be about the theorems I told you about last week. You remember the...

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Don't tell me now. Tell me right before the test. I won't be able to remember long enough.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You graduating this year will be proof that miracles happen.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: James called me last night looking for you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: The usual, 9:15.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: He probably wanted to drive over.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Were you with Bobby? Or are you two still fighting?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No, and yes. I don't know what I'm going to do about Bobby. I know he is seeing someone else and that's okay with me, and he thinks I'm seeing someone else and that's not okay with him.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Are you going to tell him about that "someone else"?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You know what your problem is?  You're just too adorable...

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You know, I think you're right. I'm just too adorable.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Laura Palmer, you're just too adorable.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm just too adorable. I'm just too adorable.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Are you going to see James tonight?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Why are you suddenly so interested in who I am going to see at night? Nighttime is my time.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You're telling me, but only because you never let me in on any of it... you're not going to see Bobby, are you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Oh god, Laura.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Well, why not?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Because Bobby is a loser, you said so yourself. He's a goon.  James is the one.  He loves you with that "lasting love"... "true love".

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Yes, James is very sweet. Why don't you get out your violin, Donna?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Sweet? God, he's gorgeous.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: James is very sweet and very gorgeous.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Do you think that if you were falling in space you would slow down after a while or go faster and faster?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Faster and faster. For a long time you wouldn't feel anything. Then you would burst into fire... forever.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Maybe I better start our homework.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Okay, I suppose I should go home.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Call me.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Sure. What do you want me to call you?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Call me anything just don't call me late for dinner.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Laura?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Donna, are you my best friend?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Of course...

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: What is it Laura? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I just want a friend. Just one friend for just one minute...

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Laura, how about one friend for the rest of your whole life?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Yes, that's what I want. Thanks D.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Okay, L.  I am your friend... always. But sometimes... lately... I feel that you don't like being around me because I am so uptight.  No, I am uptight. I hate it... I don't want to be this way, but Laura I don't... I mean... I'm your friend no matter what way you are.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You know, even when I think about your face I get happier.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Do you want to talk?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No, I want to smoke.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I'm in a mess today, too.  I'm thinking about doing it with Mike. What do you think?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Donna, you are such a crack up. You don't even like Mike. Is this what you are going to do to show me you are not uptight.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: This is about sex, not like.  Mom, Laura's here and I think I will have one of those huckleberry muffins.  You want a muffin?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: If I can smoke it.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You want a muffin?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Donna, you are a muffin.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Goodbye, Muffin.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No, you're the muffin.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No place, fast.  And you're not coming.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Come on, Laura. I'm your best friend.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Isn't tonight the night you are going to do it with Mike?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Laura, aren't you going to fix me a drink?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Where are the Cookies?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You mean Fred and Ginger?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Dancing.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: If I had a nickel for every cigarette your mom smoked, I'd be dead.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Gotta go, Donna. I'll call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: No.  I don't need to take this to be your friend.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: YES YOU DO, DONNA. What a downer you are!!!

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Don't ever wear my stuff, don't ever wear my stuff. Never.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Okay, I won't wear your stuff... Why can't I wear your stuff?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Jacques, help me get her home. NOW!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I won't wear your stuff.  I promise.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Not you, Donna, not you.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I can't remember anything about last night. Is there something I should remember?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No, you should forget about last night.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Laura, I am your friend.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I know you are and you don't have to do anything crazy to prove it.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You're not mad at me?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I feel so bad. I had nightmares all night long.  They all knew you at that place.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What can I tell you?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: How did the car get back here?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: WE got it back, that's all.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: How did I get in the house? How did I get into my bed?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I can't help you there.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Was I wearing something of yours and you got mad at me?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: All my things have me in them. I don't want you to be like me.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: But I love you, Laura.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: And I love you, too. But don't wear my stuff.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Why do you do it, Laura?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Cause I like it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, Pete. Can't believe your tank's dry up at the mill.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No... hell, no. Just got in the truck, started drivin', looked down at the gauge and saw a big "E" starin' at me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know what that Big "E" stands for? Big Ed's Gas Farm.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yep. You're right. That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What'll it be?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Fill 'er up.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I haven't got it yet.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nice night.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yep...  Yes...  It is.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: You missed somethin', Ed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I did? I didn't see anything.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah... look in here. Look at it from this angle.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Even this heavy work beats being at home with the old ball and chain.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Brother, I hear you talkin'.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: My secret diary. There are pages missing.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: Who would do that?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Bob.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: But Bob isn't real.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: The pages are gone. That's real.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Bob is real. He's been "having" me since I was 12.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: The diary was hidden too well. He's the only one who could know where it was. He's getting to know me, now. He's real. He speaks to me.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: What does Bob say?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: He wants to be me... or he will kill me.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: No... No...

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Oh, yes... yes...

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You're not Bob are you, Harold? If you are, you can kill me right now. Kill me right now, if you are.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: Laura, no, I'm not. I'm not Bob.  Poor Laura. I wish I could help you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I hate him, I hate it. Sometimes I love it. But now I'm afraid. I am so afraid.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: But you're strong Laura... so much stronger than I... How can I help you? I can't. I can't even go outside.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: What about James? Can't James help you? You two are so in love.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: He's in love with a girl who's dead.  It is dangerous for you to have it. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: I'm so sorry, Laura.

turns.speaker: JACOBY
turns.text: Laura, you didn't come and see me today.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I couldn't it was Johnny Horne's birthday. I promised I'd be with him. I told you not to call me here.

turns.speaker: JACOBY
turns.text: A little trouble with your parents is the least of your worries and something I am certainly willing to put up with.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: JACOBY
turns.text: Did you make me a tape?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I already made you two tapes.

turns.speaker: JACOBY
turns.text: Laura, you have to deal with all of this.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm dealing with it, Doc. Big time. Maybe I'll make you a tape tomorrow. Goodnight.

turns.speaker: JACOBY
turns.text: Send me a kiss.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Baby, you know why? Cause it'll never get here.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Hey, Jacques...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No "Jacques". I am the Great Went.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I am The Muffin.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: And what a muffin you have.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: That's right. She called me. She even asked me what your fathers looked like...

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What? She asked about my father?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: But it wasn't him... she was after a huge guy, six foot four with a broken nose. She said he looked just like a boxer. Speaking of sandwiches... I think Bobby was arranging something for you...  Speaking of arrangements...  SPEAKING OF ARRANGEMENTS... Why don't you two come up to the cabin this week? Leo and I know that Santy Claus is coming to town... Thursday.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Right on time, baby.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Buy me a ticket to The Great Went.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: We're on our way, Baby.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Let's go all the way.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: James...

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Laura, I'll meet you at 2:30 after phys. ed.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Laura, do you love me?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Yes, I love you. I've told you, but it doesn't really matter.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Why? It does.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No, it doesn't... just kiss me.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: It does matter. We're in love.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: James, you don't know what you are talking about. Quit trying to hold on so tight. I'm gone... long gone like a turkey through the corn.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: You're not a turkey. A turkey is one of the dumbest birds on earth.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Gobble, gobble, gobble.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Where were you last night? We were supposed to get together. You didn't show up.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You were supposed to show up. Maybe I wasn't.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: We were supposed to be together.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: How can I be together if I'm not together?

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: You're on somethin' again, aren't you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: James...

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: When am I going to see you?

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: I've got to see you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Not now.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: This afternoon?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Okay.  Oh god, it's Johnny Horne's birthday today.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What about tonight?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I can't tonight.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I just can't, James. I can't do it.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: That's right. There's no place left to go is there, James?

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You know it and I know it.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What is wrong with us?... We have everything.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Everything, but everything.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Oh, Laura.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: "Oh, Laura..."

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: You always hurt the ones you love.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You mean the ones you pity.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Say anything you want... I know you love me and I love you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I do love you.  Let's get lost together.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Shit, maybe he'll kill you.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: When he finds out.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Bobby killed a guy.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: What are you talking about? Bobby didn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You want to see...

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: See what?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Right. Open your eyes, James. You don't know me. Even Donna doesn't know me. Your Laura disappeared... It's just me now.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Johnny, Johnny... let your Daddy and your Uncle and Leland talk.  Ben... Leland, we can play the French against the Norwegians. What do the French love more than anything?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Boating?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Hiking?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Eating?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You'd think so.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Sex?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're getting warmer.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Trees?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Exactment. They are nuts about wood. They get goofy over trees.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: History is on our side, Ben. It's no accident that the great explorers were named Hennepin, Nicollet, Marquette.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: They were looking for wood.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Josie, I think we should go public.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: That would be wonderful, but it's only been a year since Andrew died.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: What are you afraid of? What people think?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I don't want to offend the customs of your country.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Believe me, Josie, you would not offend the customs of this country. For instance, I don't eat fish eyes.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Fish eyes?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: Even if it offended someone, I wouldn't eat a fish eye.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Why wouldn't you eat a fish eye, Harry?

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I saw a guy eat a fish eye once in Seattle. He was digging through his food with his chopsticks for about five minutes till he found the fish eye and he dropped it into his throat. I guess it must have gotten stuck in his uvula because right away he started to have trouble. His throat began to flutter there like there was a wind blowing. And he couldn't swallow and they rushed to him and loosened his collar and they were asking him if he was alright and he started to turn blue and his eyes started to roll back into his head and he still couldn't get the fish eye out and they tried to do a Heimlich maneuver. I went over to him as they were preparing to do an emergency tracheotomy. They were over him with a knife when he suddenly shot the fish eye out of his throat and right onto the ceiling. Splat! It just stuck up there and spread out. It was about the size of a half dollar. And that's why I don't ever eat fish eyes.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: I'm not saying it's right or wrong, it's just the way I feel. It's the custom thing I was thinking of. In America we don't use any part of the fish but the meat just to the side of the insides. We throw away the tail, the rest of the insides and the head.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: TRUMAN
turns.text: We throw away the whole head.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Can I take the car?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Sure honey, what's the hurry?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I forgot my books at school.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Laura.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: You lied to me about those school books. I found them upstairs on your bed.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What were you doing in my room?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I was looking for that blue sweater that you borrowed which I found balled up in the bottom of your closet. Now why did you lie to me? Where did you go?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I had to see Bobby. I know you really don't like Bobby, but there was a problem and I didn't think you would understand.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh, honey, you don't have to lie to me. Ever. You can tell me anything. I'll understand.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mom.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Now hurry, dinner's almost ready. Your father says he's starving.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Laura, now I can't find that blue sweater. Did you take it again?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Mom... what are you wearing?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: My god, I am going to have another breakdown. God, god.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Mom, take it easy.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I hate asparagus.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Sure you do, it's good for you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Where's Dad?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Ben asked him to stay late to plan for the Norwegians.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: If it's okay with you I'm going to Bobby's to do my homework.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's a school night... back by nine.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Good night, Mom.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Good night, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Dad.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Hyggelig a mote dem. Jeg Heter Leland Palmer.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: The Norwegians are coming next week and I want you to learn to say what I just learned in Norwegian. So you can talk to them. I want you to learn to say, "Hello, my name is Leland Palmer".

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: But my name isn't Leland Palmer.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Hi, honey, how's Donna?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: School?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: ...school's fine...

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Sit down... sit down... Are you hungry?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Let me see.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Dad...

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Your hands are filthy... look, there is dirt way under this fingernail.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: A friend from school.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: A special friend?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Dad... Dad... Who was that? How do you know him? He looked familiar. Have I met him?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: No, you haven't met him. Have you met him?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: We're late to get to your mother.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Just sit here for a moment. You seem very upset.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Guy just pulls up out of the blue... I mean... what is this world coming to?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Are you sure you're okay?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Dad?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Did you come home during the day last week?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Oh, I thought I saw you.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: You know, I did come home, come to think of it, on Thursday. I had a severe headache and I was driving in the neighborhood so I just darted in and out of the house.  Where were you, Laura? I didn't see you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I was down the street.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Laura. What's wrong this morning?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Stay away from me.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: DON'T MAKE ME DO IT.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: NO, YOU HAVE TO KILL ME.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: I always thought you knew it was me.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: NO! YOU CAN'T HAVE ME.  KILL ME.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Hello, Laura. Hello Sarah. Where's my axe?  "I'm hungry".

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh, Leland.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Neither is mine. And can't we talk about something serious for a change.

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: This is serious. Mr. Benjamin Horne's got a delegation of Norwegians coming in next week and I want both of you to learn to introduce yourself. Sarah, you first.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Leland, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Look at this finger here.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Leland...

turns.speaker: LELAND
turns.text: Laura didn't wash her hands before dinner.  And look at this.
